snippet: Officials could not say for sure whether the low growth reflected the start of a trend or the continuing effects of the recession.
abstract: Obama administration says that national health spending climbed to $2.7 trillion in 2011, or average of $8,700 for every person in country, but remained stable as share of economy for third consecutive year; officials cannot say for sure whether low growth represents start of trend or reflects continuing effects of recession.
lead_paragraph: Officials could not say for sure whether the low growth reflected the start of a trend or the continuing effects of the recession.

headline.seo: Health Spending Growth Stays Low for 3rd Straight Year
headline.main: Growth of Health Spending Stays Low
headline.print_headline: Growth of Health Spending Stays Low
